DataElement.preferredName: Person Abdominal Cavity Fistula Perforation Abscess Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a person has abdominal fistula, an abnormal communication most commonly seen between two internal organs, perforation; a hole made through a part or substance, or abscess, an accumulation of purulent material in tissues, organs, or circumscribed spaces, usually associated with signs of infection, as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Abdominal Cavity Fistula Perforation Abscess Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person having abdominal fistula, an abnormal communication most commonly seen between two internal organs, perforation; a hole made through a part or substance, or abscess, an accumulation of purulent material in tissues, organs, or circumscribed spaces, usually associated with signs of infection, as an element of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Property.preferredName: Abdominal Cavity Fistula Perforation Abscess Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: That portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis.:Abnormal communication most commonly seen between two internal organs, or between an internal organ and the surface of the body.:Perforation; a hole made through a part or substance. (On-line Medical Dictionary):Accumulation of purulent material in tissues, organs, or circumscribed spaces, usually associated with signs of infection.:Elements of a personal medical history which are necessary to allow an individual to participate in a specific clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.
Abnormal epithelial-lined communication between two anatomical structures.
A hole or opening made through a membrane or other tissue or material.

An inflammatory process characterized by the accumulation of pus within a newly formed tissue cavity which is the result of a bacterial, fungal, or parasitic infection or the presence of a foreign body.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a histo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of abdominal fistula, gastrointestinal perforation, intra-abdominal abscess within 28 days prior to first day of study therapy or an underlying lesion(s) that caused the fistula or perforation in the past that have not been corrected?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of abdominal fistula, gastrointestinal perforation or intra-abdominal abscess?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of fistula, intra-abdominal abscess or bowel perforation within 6 months prior to first day of study therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient require total parenteral nutrition or parenteral hydration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient require parenteral hydration or parenteral/total parenteral nutrition?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have abdominal fistula, gastrointestinal perforation, bowel obstruction or gastric outlet obstruction, intra-abdominal abscess within 6 months of registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of abdominal fistula, gastrointestinal perforation, intra-abdominal abscess, bowel obstruction, or gastric outlet obstruction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of abdominal fistula, gastrointestinal perforation or intra-abdominal abscess within indicated time period

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text7
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of abdominal fistula or intra-abdominal abscess requiring a major surgical procedure within 28 days prior to step 2 registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior bowel obstruction, abdominal fistula, gastrointestinal perforation, or intra-abdominal abscess

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF text 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of abdominal fistula, gastrointestinal perforation or intra-abdominal abscess within 28 days prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text8
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of abdominal fistula or intra-abdominal abscess  within 28 days prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of fistula, gastrointestinal ulcer or perforation, or intra-abdominal abscess within indicated time period

ReferenceDocuments.name: eligibility question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of abdominal fistula within 6 months prior to study entry that has not been surgically repaired or she is considered high risk for recurrence of fistula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of abdominal fistula within 6 months prior to study entry that has not been surgically repaired/healed  or she is considered high risk for recurrence of fistula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of abdominal/pelvic or tracheoesophageal fistula or gastrointestinal perforation and/or abscess within 6 months prior to the anticipated Cycle 1, Day 1

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF TEXT 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of abdominal fistula, gastrointestinal perforation, or intra-abdominal abscess within 28 days of study enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of abdominal fistula?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of abdominal/pelvic or tracheoesophageal fistula or gastrointestinal perforation and/or abdominal/pelvic abscess within 6 months prior to the anticipated Cycle 1, Day 1

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of abdominal fistula, gastrointestinal perforation or intra-abdominal abscess within 3 months prior to study registration?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Alliance - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior perforation, abscess or fistula?
